title: Lowe's Sales Drop Again as Homeowners Pull Back on Discretionary Purchases; Home-improvement chain to spend $55 million on bonuses to front-line workers to soften impact of inflation
text:
Lowe's said same-store sales, which strips out effects of store openings and closings, fell 0.3% in the second-quarter. In the U.S., the figure increased slightly.

The unexpected sales drop comes a day after top rival Home Depot Inc. posted a 5.8% in same-store sales, as it raised prices across its stores to offset a drop in customer transactions.

Write to Dean Seal at dean.seal@wsj.com

Lowe's Sales Drop Again as Homeowners Pull Back on Discretionary Purchases
